-  [Compare Files and Folders of Unstructured Data Backup with Source](Backup-Browsers#operation/UnstructuredDataFlrBrowseCompareToProduction)

**Restore**
-  [Restore Entire File Share](Restore#operation/EntireUnstructuredDataShareRestore)
-  [Restore Entire Bucket or Container](Restore#operation/EntireUnstructuredDataOSRestore)
-  [Get All Mount Points for Instant File Share Recovery](Restore#operation/GetAllInstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryMounts)
-  [Start Instant File Share Recovery](Restore#operation/InstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryMount)
-  [Get Mount Point for Instant File Share Recovery](Restore#operation/GetInstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryMount)
-  [Stop File Share Publishing](Restore#operation/InstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryUnmount)
-  [Start File Share Migration](Restore#operation/InstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryMigrate)
-  [Start File Share Switchover](Restore#operation/InstantUnstructuredDataShareSwitchover)
-  [Get File Share Switchover Settings](Restore#operation/GetUnstructuredDataShareIRSwitchoverSettings)
-  [Update File Share Switchover Settings](Restore#operation/UpdateUnstructuredDataShareIRSwitchoverSettings)
-  [Start File Restore from Unstructured Data Backup](Restore#operation/StartUnstructuredDataFlrMount)
-  [Unmount Unstructured Data FLR Volumes](Restore#operation/StopUnstructuredDataFLRMount)

### Updated Schema

Note the following changes:

- The `typeFilter` parameter has been added to the [Get All Unstructured Data Servers](Inventory-Browser#operation/CreateUnstructuredDataServer) request, which allows you to filter unstructured data servers by their type.
- The `FileInstantRecovery` and `FileInstantRecoveryMigration` types have been added to the `ESessionType` enumeration type.
- The `JobModel` object has been updated with the following child schemas:
  + `FileBackupJobModel`
  + `ObjectStorageBackupJobModel`
- The `JobSpec` object has been updated with the following child schemas:
  + `FileBackupJobSpec`
  + `ObjectStorageBackupJobSpec`
- The following types have been added to the `EJobType` enumeration type:
  + `FileBackup`
  + `ObjectStorageBackup`

## Users and Roles
Veeam Backup & Replication REST API 1.3-rev1 introduces new requests that allow you to manage Veeam Backup & Replication users, groups and assigned roles.

### New Operations
-  [Get All Users and Groups](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUsers)
-  [Add User or Group](Users-and-Roles#operation/CreateUser)
-  [Get User or Group](Users-and-Roles#operation/GetUser)
-  [Remove User or Group](Users-and-Roles#operation/DeleteUser)
-  [Get User Roles](Users-and-Roles#operation/GetUserRoles)
-  [Edit User Roles](Users-and-Roles#operation/UpdateUserRoles)
-  [Change Service Account Mode](Users-and-Roles#operation/ChangeServiceAccountMode)
-  [Reset MFA for Specific User](Users-and-Roles#operation/ResetUserMfa)
-  [Get All Roles](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUserRoles)
-  [Get Role](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewUserRole)
-  [Get Role Permissions](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewUserRolePermissions)
-  [Get MFA Settings](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewUsersSettings)
-  [Edit MFA Settings](Users-and-Roles#operation/UpdateUsersSettings)

## General Options

Veeam Backup & Replication REST API 1.3-rev1 now allows you to modify the general options in a more granular manner. The previous requests have been deprecated — for more information, see [Deprecated Requests](SectionChangelog#section/Deprecated-Requests).

### New Operations
- [Get Email Settings](General-Options#operation/GetEmailSettings)
- [Update Email Settings](General-Options#operation/UpdateEmailSettings)
- [Send Test Email](General-Options#operation/SendTestEmailMessage)
- [Get Notification Settings](General-Options#operation/GetNotificationsSettings)
- [Edit Notification Settings](General-Options#operation/UpdateNotificationsSettings)
- [Get Event Forwarding Settings](General-Options#operation/GetEventForwardingSettings)
- [Edit Event Forwarding Settings](General-Options#operation/UpdateEventForwardingSettings)
- [Get Storage Latency Settings](General-Options#operation/GetStorageLatencySettings)
- [Edit Storage Latency Settings](General-Options#operation/UpdateStorageLatencySettings)
- [Add Latency Settings for Specific Datastore](General-Options#operation/AddDatastoreLatency)
- [Get Latency Settings for Specific Datastore](General-Options#operation/GetDatastoreLatencySettings)
- [Edit Latency Settings for Specific Datastore](General-Options#operation/UpdateDatastoreLatencySettings)
- [Remove Latency Settings for Specific Datastore](General-Options#operation/DeleteDatastoreLatencySettings)

## Backups

In this version, the REST API has the new [Copy Backups to Another Repository](Backups#operation/CopyBackups) request, which allows you to perform a one-time copy of backups to a specified target repository and, if specified, archive repository.

## Malware Detection

REST API 1.3-rev1 introduces the [Get Logs for SureBackup Scan Task Session](Malware-Detection#operation/GetScanSessionLog) request, which allows you to get detailed logs about the progress of the SureBackup Lite job.

# Deprecated Requests

The following requests are deprecated in REST API 1.3-rev1:  
- [Get General Options](General-Options#operation/GetGeneralOptions)
- [Edit General Options](General-Options#operation/UpdateGeneralOptions)

# Minor Non-Breaking Changes

The following minor non-breaking changes are introduced in REST API 1.3-rev1.

## License

The `UniversalCdpWindows` type has been added to the `ELicensePlatformType` enumeration type.

## Credentials

The [Get All Helper Appliances](Credentials#operation/GetAllCredsHelperAppliancesWithFiltering) request now accepts the `skip` and `limit` parameters, which allow you to skip helper appliances and limit the number of helper appliances returned by the request.

## Backup Browsers

- The [Get All Restore Sessions of Microsoft Entra ID Tenant](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseEntraIDTenantRestoreSessionsWithFiltering) request now accepts the `skip` and `limit` parameters, which allow you to skip restore sessions and limit the number of restore sessions returned by the request.
- The `restorePointId` and `restorePointDate` properties of the `EntraIdTenantBrowseModel` object are no longer required.
- The `includedTypes` property has been added to the `EntraIdTenantDeviceConfigurationFilterBrowseSpec` object.
- The `restoreType` property has been added to the `FileBackupFLRCopyToSpec` object.

## Malware Detection

- The [Get All Malware Events](Malware-Detection#operation/ViewSuspiciousActivityEvents) request now accepts the `createdAfterTimeUtcFilter` and `createdBeforeTimeUtcFilter` parameters, which allow you to filter malware events by the time they were created.
- The `pagination` property of the `YaraRulesResult` object is now required.

## Security

The `CockpitMessage` type has been added to the `EAuthorizationEventState` enumeration.

## Inventory Browser

The `protectionScope` property has been added to the `EntraIDTenantModel` and `EntraIDTenantSpec` objects.

## Repositories

- The `enableAutoProvision` and `workloadsPerBucketLimit` properties have been added to the `S3CompatibleStorageBucketModel` object.
- The `credentialsId` property of the `SmbRepositoryShareSettingsModel` object is no longer required.
- The `importOptions` property has been added to the `LinuxHardenedStorageModel`, `LinuxLocalStorageModel`, `NfsStorageModel`,`SmbStorageModel` and `WindowsLocalStorageModel` objects. The property allows Veeam Backup & Replication to search the repository for existing backups and import them automatically.

## Backups

The [Get Backup Objects](Backups#operation/GetBackupObjectsWithFiltering) request now accepts the `skip` and `limit` parameters, which allow you to skip backup objects and limit the number of backup objects returned by the request.

## Backup Objects

The [Get Restore Points](Backup-Objects#operation/GetBackupObjectRestorePointsWithFiltering) request now accepts the `skip`, `limit`, `orderColumn`, `orderAsc`, `createdAfterFilter`, `createdBeforeFilter`, `nameFilter`, `platformNameFilter`, `platformIdFilter`, `backupIdFilter`, `backupObjectIdFilter` and `malwareStatusFilter` parameters, which allow you to filter restore points returned by the request.

## Jobs

- The [Edit Job](Jobs#operation/UpdateJob) request now has the `allowOldGfsPointsRetention` parameter, which allows you to remove existing GFS restore points when you modify the GFS retention policy.
- The `EHypeVProxyType` property has been renamed to `EHyperVProxyType`.

## Restore

The [Get All Instant Recovery Mount Points of VMware vSphere VMs](Restore#operation/GetAllInstantViVMRecoveryMounts) request now has the `mountIdFilter` parameter, which allows you to filter mount points by the `mountId` property.

## Restore Points

The [Get Restore Point Disks](Restore-Points#operation/GetObjectRestorePointDisksWithFiltering) request now accepts the `skip` and `limit` parameters, which allow you to skip restore point disks and limit the number of restore point disks returned by the request.

## Data Integration API

- The `reason` property has been added to the `PublishBackupContentSpec` object.
- The `targetServerCredentialsId` and `singleUseSSHCredentials` properties have been added to the `FUSELinuxMountSpec` object.

## Sessions

- The `Type` type has been added to the `EEntraIdTenantDeviceConfigurationSortingProperty` enumeration type.
- The `BackupCopyJob` and `SureBackupContentScan` types have been added to the `ESessionType` enumeration type.

## Managed Servers

The [Rescan All Managed Servers](Managed-Servers#operation/RescanAllManagedServers) request now accepts the `ManagedServersSpec` schema in its request body, which allows you to rescan only the specified managed servers.

# Breaking Changes

Breaking changes cause REST API to function differently and can affect the client code.

## Backup Browsers

The required `targetName` property has been added to the `FlrTaskItemModel` object. 

## Data Integration API

The required `credentialsStorageType` property has been added to the `FUSELinuxMountSpec` object.

## Jobs

- The `storage` property of the `EntraIDAuditLogBackupJobSpec` object is now required.
- The `fileServerId` property of the `FileBackupJobObjectModel` object is now required.
- The `type` and `quantity` properties of the `FileBackupRetentionPolicySettingsModel` object are now required.

## Restore

- The `subnet` property of the `AzureComputeNetworkModel` and `AzureInstantVMRecoveryApplianceModel` objects is now required.
- The required `include` property has been added to the `AzureComputeVMDiskConfigurationModel` object. In addition, the `diskUid` property is now required.
- The `overwrite` property has been added to the `EntireViVMRestoreSpec` object.

## Agents

The `isTrusted` required property has been added to the `DiscoveredComputerEntityModel` object.
tags.name: SectionChangelog
Login
tags.description: The authorization process involves obtaining an access token and a refresh token. For details on the authorization process and security settings, see [Authorization and Security](https://helpcenter.veeam.com/references/vbr/13/rest/1.3-rev1/tag/SectionOverview#section/Authorization-and-Security).<SecurityDefinitions />

tags.name: Service
tags.description: The Service section defines paths and operations for retrieving information about the backup server where the REST API service is running.

tags.name: Services
tags.description: The Services section defines a path and operation for retrieving information about associated backend services. You may need to connect to these services for integration with Veeam Backup & Replication.

tags.name: Credentials
tags.description: The Credentials section defines paths and operations for managing credentials records that are added to the backup server.

tags.name: Encryption
tags.description: The Encryption section defines paths and operations for managing KMS servers and passwords that are used for data encryption.

tags.name: License
tags.description: The License section defines paths and operations for installing and managing licenses on the backup server.

tags.name: Connection
tags.description: The Connection section defines a path and operation for retrieving a TLS certificate or SSH fingerprint used to establish a secure connection between the backup server and the specified server.

tags.name: Cloud Browser
tags.description: The Cloud Browser section defines paths and operations for retrieving information about cloud compute and storage resources. The Cloud Browser section helps you map a cloud folder with an object storage repository.

tags.name: Inventory Browser
tags.description:
The Inventory Browser section defines paths and operations that allow you to:
  • Retrieve virtualization servers and their virtual infrastructure objects (data centers, clusters, hosts, resource pools, vApps, VMs and so on). In this version, you can browse VMware vSphere, VMware Cloud Director and Microsoft Hyper-V objects.
  • Manage computers, cloud machines, clusters and Active Directory objects with protection groups.
  • Manage unstructured data sources.
  • Manage Microsoft Entra ID tenants.

tags.name: Traffic Rules
tags.description: The Traffic Rules section defines paths and operations for retrieving and editing information about network traffic rules that are configured on the backup server.

tags.name: General Options
tags.description: The General Options section defines paths and operations for retrieving and editing general settings of Veeam Backup & Replication.

tags.name: Users and Roles
tags.description: The Users and Roles section defines paths and operations for managing Veeam Backup & Replication users, groups and assigned roles.

tags.name: Global Exclusions
tags.description: The Global Exclusions section defines paths and operations for managing which VMs will be excluded from processing, even if they are included in jobs. In this version, you can use these operations for VMware vSphere, VMware Cloud Director and Microsoft Hyper-V VMs.

tags.name: Security
tags.description: The Security section defines paths and operations for managing Security & Compliance Analyzer and getting four-eyes authorization events.

tags.name: Malware Detection
tags.description: The Malware Detection section defines paths and operations for managing malware events and scanning backups with antivirus software or YARA rules.

tags.name: Configuration Backup
tags.description: The Configuration Backup section defines paths and operations for managing backup of the configuration database that Veeam Backup & Replication uses.

tags.name: Deployment
tags.description: The Deployment section defines paths and operations for generating and downloading a deployment kit that is used for adding Microsoft Windows machines as managed servers.

tags.name: Managed Servers
tags.description:
The Managed Servers section defines paths and operations for managing servers.

NOTE
In this version, the REST API supports the following server types: *VMware vSphere*, *Hyper-V*, *Linux* and *Windows*.

tags.name: Repositories
tags.description:
The Repositories section defines paths and operations for managing backup repositories.

NOTE
In this version, the REST API supports the following storage types: direct attached storage (Microsoft Windows and Linux servers), network attached storage (SMB and NFS shares), object storage repositories and Veeam Data Cloud Vault repositories. For details on how to add an object storage repository, see [Object Storage Repositories](https://helpcenter.veeam.com/references/vbr/13/rest/1.3-rev1/tag/SectionHowTo#section/Object-Storage-Repositories).

tags.name: Mount Servers
tags.description: The Mount Servers section defines paths and operations for managing mount servers in your backup infrastructure. Mount servers are used in advanced restore operations (file restore, application item restore and Instant Recovery).

tags.name: Proxies
tags.description:
The Proxies section defines paths and operations for managing backup proxies.

NOTE
In this version, the REST API supports VMware vSphere backup proxies, Microsoft Hyper-V off-host backup proxies and general-purpose backup proxies used with Veeam Agents and unstructured data.

tags.name: WAN Accelerators
tags.description: The WAN Accelerators section defines paths and operations for managing WAN accelerators.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description:
The Jobs section defines paths and operations for managing jobs that are coordinated by the backup server.

NOTE
In this version, the REST API supports the following job types:
  • `VSphereBackup` — VMware vSphere backup jobs.
  • `vSphereReplica` — VMware vSphere replication jobs.
  • `HyperVBackup` — Microsoft Hyper-V backup jobs.
  • `CloudDirectorBackup` — VMware Cloud Director backup jobs.
  • `WindowsAgentBackup` — Veeam Agent backup jobs for Microsoft Windows computers.
  • `LinuxAgentBackup` — Veeam Agent backup jobs for Linux computers.
  • `WindowsAgentBackupWorkstationPolicy` — Veeam Agent backup policies for Microsoft Windows computers of the workstation type.
  • `LinuxAgentBackupWorkstationPolicy` — Veeam Agent backup policies for Linux computers of the workstation type.
  • `WindowsAgentBackupServerPolicy` — Veeam Agent backup policies for Linux computers of the server type.
  • `LinuxAgentBackupServerPolicy` — Veeam Agent backup policies for Linux computers of the server type.
  • `EntraIDTenantBackup` — Microsoft Entra ID tenant backup jobs.
  • `EntraIDAuditLogBackup` — Microsoft Entra ID audit log backup jobs.
  • `FileBackup` — File share backup jobs.
  • `ObjectStorageBackup` — Object storage backup jobs.
  • `SureBackupContentScan` — SureBackup Lite jobs that perform backup verification and content scan only (full recoverability testing in virtual labs is not available). In the current version, SureBackup is supported only for backups created with Veeam Backup for Microsoft Azure, Veeam Backup for AWS, or Veeam Backup for Google Cloud.
  • `BackupCopy` — VMware vSphere and Microsoft Hyper-V backup copy jobs.
  • `FileBackupCopy` — Backup copy jobs for file shares.
VMware vSphere jobs can process inventory objects of the following types: *VirtualMachine*, *vCenterServer*, *Datacenter*, *Cluster*, *Host*, *ResourcePool*, *Folder*, *Template*, *Tag*, *Datastore* and *DatastoreCluster*. Objects with tags combination (or *Multitag*) are not supported.

tags.name: Backups
tags.description: The Backups section defines paths and operations for managing backups that are created on or imported to the backup server.

tags.name: Backup Objects
tags.description:
The Backup Objects section defines paths and operations for managing backup objects — VMs and vApps that are included in backups created by the backup server.

Types of backup objects differ depending on the backup job platform:

  • Backups of VMware vSphere jobs contain VMs only.
  • Backups of VMware Cloud Director jobs contain VMs and vApps.

tags.name: Restore Points
tags.description: The Restore Points section defines paths and operations for retrieving restore points created on the backup server and backed up disks from the restore points.

tags.name: Restore
tags.description:
The Restore section defines paths and operations for performing restore.

NOTE
In this version, the REST API supports the following recovery operations:
  • Instant Recovery of a VMware vSphere VM to VMware vSphere
  • Instant Recovery of a Microsoft Hyper-V VM to Microsoft Hyper-V
  • Instant Recovery of Microsoft Windows and Linux machines to Microsoft Azure
  • Instant File Share Recovery to the original or another location
  • Entire VM restore of a VMware vSphere VM to VMware vSphere
  • Entire VM restore of a Microsoft Hyper-V VM to Microsoft Hyper-V
  • Entire VM restore of a VMware Cloud Director VM to VMware Cloud Director
  • Restore of an entire file share, bucket or container to the original or another location
  • Restore of disks that will be registered as First Class Disks (FCD) — a type of virtual disks that can be managed independent of any VM
  • File restore from a backup or replica of a Microsoft Windows or Linux machine
  • File restore from an unstructured data backup
  • Microsoft Entra ID item restore
  • Microsoft Entra ID audit log restore

tags.name: Data Integration API
tags.description: The Data Integration API section defines paths and operations for publishing disks from backups and snapshot replicas.

tags.name: Backup Browsers
tags.description:
The Backup Browser section defines paths and operations that allow you to:
  • Browse the file system, compare files and folders, and perform file restore.
  • Browse Microsoft Entra ID tenant backups, compare Microsoft Entra ID items, and restore entire items or their properties.
  • Browse the Microsoft Entra ID log files, compare files and folders, and restore Microsoft Entra ID logs.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description: The Tasks section defines paths and operations for managing tasks that are used to perform runtime operations (file restore and rescan of inventory objects).

tags.name: Replicas
tags.description: The Replicas section defines paths and operations for managing snapshot replicas.

tags.name: Replica Restore Points
tags.description: The Replica Restore Points section defines paths and operations for managing restore points of snapshot replicas.

tags.name: Failover
tags.description: The Failover section defines paths and operations for managing failover.

tags.name: Failback
tags.description: The Failback section defines paths and operations for managing failback.

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description: The Sessions section defines paths and operations for managing sessions (except [automation sessions](Automation#operation/GetAllAutomationSessions)) and task sessions performed on the backup server.

tags.name: Agents
tags.description: The Agents section defines paths and operations for working with protection groups, obtaining protected computers, managing Veeam Agent and other Veeam components on the computers and handling recovery tokens used for bare metal recovery.

tags.name: Active Directory Domains
tags.description: The Active Directory Domains section defines paths and operations for managing Active Directory domains.

tags.name: Automation
tags.description: The Automation section defines paths and operations for granular import and export of objects available in the REST API. It can be useful, for example, if you set up the backup infrastructure using JSON specification or migrate the infrastructure to another backup server. For details, see [Mass Deployment](https://helpcenter.veeam.com/references/vbr/13/rest/1.3-rev1/tag/SectionHowTo#section/Mass-Deployment).

tags.name: Log export
tags.description: The Log Export section defines paths and operations for exporting the backup server logs.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/serverTime` endpoint gets the current date and time on the backup server.

**Available to**: Anyone.

The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/serverCertificate` endpoint gets a certificate of the backup server.

**Available to**: Anyone.

The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/serverInfo` endpoint gets the Veeam Backup & Replication installation ID, backup server name (or IP address), build number and cumulative patches installed on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.summary: Register Backup Server on My Account Portal
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/registerVbr` endpoint registers the backup server on the My Account portal.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/services` endpoint gets associated services for integration with Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of services to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of services to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts services by one of the service parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts services in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters services by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any service parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/install` endpoint installs a license on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/license` endpoint gets the installed license on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/remove` endpoint removes a license from the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/createReport` endpoint creates a license usage report for the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/renew` endpoint renews the license on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/license/sockets` endpoint gets information about the consumption of socket licenses on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of workloads to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of workloads to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts workloads by one of the socket workload parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts workloads in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any workload parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: hostNameFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by hostname.

parameters.name: hostIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by host ID.

parameters.name: socketsNumberFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by the number of sockets they use.

parameters.name: coresNumberFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by the number of CPU cores they use.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by host type.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/sockets/{hostId}/revoke` endpoint revokes a socket license from the host with the specified `hostId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: hostId
parameters.description: ID of the licensed host. To get the host ID, run the [Get Installed License](License#operation/GetInstalledLicense) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/license/instances` endpoint gets information about instance license consumption on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of workloads to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of workloads to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts workloads by one of the workload parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts workloads in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any instance workload parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: hostNameFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by hostname.

parameters.name: usedInstancesNumberFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by the number of consumed instances.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by workload type.

parameters.name: instanceIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters workloads by instance ID.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/instances/{instanceId}/assign` endpoint sets the product edition for a standalone Veeam Agent with the specified `instanceId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: Instance ID. To get the instance ID, run the [Get Installed License](License#operation/GetInstalledLicense) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/instances/{instanceId}/revoke` endpoint revokes an instance license from the workload that has the specified `instanceId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: Instance ID. To get the instance ID, run the [Get Installed License](License#operation/GetInstalledLicense) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/instances/{instanceId}/remove` endpoint removes a licensed Agent instance from the workload that has the specified `instanceId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: Instance ID. To get the instance ID, run the [Get Installed License](License#operation/GetInstalledLicense) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/license/capacity` endpoint gets information about the capacity license instance consumption by file shares and object storage repositories.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.summary: Revoke Capacity License From Unstructured Data Workload
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/capacity/{instanceId}/revoke` endpoint revokes a capacity instance with the specified `instanceId` from an unstructured data workload (file share or object storage).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: Instance ID. To get the instance ID, run the [Get Installed License](License#operation/GetInstalledLicense) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/update` endpoint manually updates your license.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.summary: Enable or Disable License Auto Update
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/autoupdate` endpoint enables or disables automatic update of the installed license.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.summary: Enable or Disable Instance Consumption for Unlicensed Agents
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/license/agentConsumption` endpoint enables or disables unlicensed standalone agents to consume instances.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/securityAnalyzer/start` endpoint starts Security & Compliance Analyzer on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

201.description: A `SecurityComplianceAnalyzer` session has been created to start Security & Compliance Analyzer. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.summary: Get Security & Compliance Analyzer Last Run
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/securityAnalyzer/lastRun` endpoint gets the last session of Security & Compliance Analyzer.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/securityAnalyzer/schedule` endpoint gets the Security & Compliance Analyzer schedule.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/securityAnalyzer/schedule` endpoint modifies the Security & Compliance Analyzer schedule.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

post.summary: Reset All Security & Compliance Analyzer Statuses
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/securityAnalyzer/bestPractices/resetAll` endpoint restores default compliance statuses for all Security & Compliance Analyzer best practices.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/securityAnalyzer/bestPractices` endpoint gets best practices compliance result from the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

post.summary: Suppress Security & Compliance Analyzer Best Practice Status
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/securityAnalyzer/bestPractices/{id}/suppress` endpoint suppresses a Security & Compliance Analyzer best practice compliance status that has the specified best practice `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Best practice ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Security & Compliance Analyzer Results](Security#operation/GetBestPracticesComplianceResult) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/securityAnalyzer/bestPractices/{id}/reset` endpoint resets the compliance status of a Security & Compliance Analyzer best practice that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Best practice ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Security & Compliance Analyzer Results](Security#operation/GetBestPracticesComplianceResult) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/oauth2/token` endpoint gets an access token and a refresh token.

**Available to**: All built-in user roles. Authentication with custom roles is not allowed.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/oauth2/logout` endpoint performs a logout operation. After you log out, your access and refresh tokens become invalid.

**Available to**: All user roles.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/trafficRules` endpoint gets network traffic rules that control traffic transferred between backup infrastructure components.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/trafficRules` endpoint edits network traffic rules that are configured on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Infrastructure` session has been created to edit the traffic rules. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions` endpoint gets Veeam Backup & Replication settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions` endpoint edits Veeam Backup & Replication settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/emailSettings` endpoint gets Veeam Backup & Replication email settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/emailSettings` endpoint edits Veeam Backup & Replication email settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/emailSettings/testMessage` endpoint sends a test email notification using the configured settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

204.description: Test email notification has been sent.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/notifications` endpoint gets Veeam Backup & Replication notifications settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/notifications` endpoint edits Veeam Backup & Replication notification settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/eventForwarding` endpoint gets Veeam Backup & Replication event forwarding settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/eventForwarding` endpoint edits Veeam Backup & Replication event forwarding settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/storageLatency` endpoint gets storage latency settings configured for backup and replication operations. Storage latency control allows you to limit Input/Output operations on the production storage where protected machines reside.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/storageLatency` endpoint edits storage latency settings configured for backup and replication operations. Storage latency control allows you to limit Input/Output operations on the production storage where protected machines reside.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.summary: Add Latency Settings for Specific Datastore
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/storageLatency/datastores` endpoint adds custom latency settings for a specific datastore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: Datastore latency settings record has been added.

get.summary: Get Latency Settings for Specific Datastore
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/storageLatency/datastores/{id}` endpoint gets custom latency settings configured for a specific datastore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a datastore latency settings record. To get the ID, run the  [Get Storage Latency Settings](General-Options#operation/GetStorageLatencySettings) request.

put.summary: Edit Latency Settings for Specific Datastore
put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/storageLatency/datastores/{id}` endpoint edits custom latency settings configured for a specific datastore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a datastore latency settings record. To get the ID, run the  [Get Storage Latency Settings](General-Options#operation/GetStorageLatencySettings) request.

delete.summary: Remove Latency Settings for Specific Datastore
delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/generalOptions/storageLatency/datastores/{id}` endpoint removes custom latency settings configured for a specific datastore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a datastore latency settings record. To get the ID, run the  [Get Storage Latency Settings](General-Options#operation/GetStorageLatencySettings) request.

204.description: Datastore latency settings record is deleted.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/security/users` endpoint gets an array of users and groups, along with their assigned roles.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of users and groups to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of users and groups to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts users and groups by one of the parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts the results in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters users and groups by the `nameFilter` pattern.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters users and groups by type.

parameters.name: roleIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters users by role `id`.

parameters.name: roleNameFilter
parameters.description: Filters users by role name.

parameters.name: isServiceAccountFilter
parameters.description: If `true`, returns only users that are service accounts.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/security/users` endpoint adds a user or group with an assigned built-in role.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: User or group has been added.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/security/users/{id}` endpoint gets a user or group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User or group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Users and Groups](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUsers) request.

delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/security/users/{id}` endpoint removes a user or group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User or group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Users and Groups](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUsers) request.

204.description: User or group has been removed.

get.summary: Get Roles Assigned to User or Group
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/security/users/{id}/roles` endpoint gets the roles assigned to a user or group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User or group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Users and Groups](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUsers) request.

put.summary: Edit Roles Assigned to User or Group
put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/security/users/{id}/roles` endpoint edits the roles assigned to a user or group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User or group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Users and Groups](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUsers) request.

200.description: User or group has been updated.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/security/users/{id}/changeServiceAccountMode` endpoint changes the service account mode of a user record that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User or group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Users and Groups](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUsers) request.

200.description: User or group has been updated.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/security/users/{id}/resetMFA` endpoint resets multi-factor authentication (MFA) for a user that has the specified `id`. The next time the user logs in, they will be prompted to configure MFA again.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: User or group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Users and Groups](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUsers) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/security/roles` endpoint gets an array of roles available in Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of roles to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of roles to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts roles by one of the role parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts roles in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters roles by the `nameFilter` pattern.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/security/roles/{id}` endpoint gets a role that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Role ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Roles](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUserRoles) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/security/roles/{id}/permissions` endpoint gets the permissions of a role that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Role ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Roles](Users-and-Roles#operation/ViewAllUserRoles) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/security/settings` endpoint checks whether multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled or disabled for all users.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/security/settings` endpoint enables or disables multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all users.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/globalExclusions/vm` endpoint gets an array of VMs that are excluded from processing.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of global VM exclusions to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of global VM exclusions to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts global VM exclusions by one of the parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts global VM exclusions in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/globalExclusions/vm` endpoint excludes a VM from processing.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: Global VM exclusion has been added.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/globalExclusions/vm/{id}` endpoint gets a global VM exclusion that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the global VM exclusion. To get the ID, run the [Get All Global VM Exclusions](Global-Exclusions#operation/GetAllGlobalVMExclusions) request.

delete.description:

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/inventory` endpoint gets an array of all servers and hosts added to the backup infrastructure.
TIP
To filter servers by type, use the following possible values:
  • For VMware VSphere: *VCenterServer*, *Folder*, *Host*
  • For VMware Cloud Director: *CloudDirectorServer*
  • For Microsoft Hyper-V: *Scvmm*, *Cluster*, *Host*
For details, see request samples.

To browse Veeam Agents inventory, run the [Get All Protection Groups](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetAllInventoryPGs) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Tape Operator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/inventory/entraId/tenants` endpoint adds a Microsoft Entra ID tenant to the backup server.

When adding a tenant, specify an existing Microsoft Entra ID app registration or let Veeam Backup & Replication create a new one. If you choose to create a new app registration, you must generate a verification code and register the new application before you start adding a tenant:

  1. To generate a code, run the [Get Microsoft Entra ID Verification Code](Credentials#operation/RequestAppRegistrationByDeviceCode) request.
  2. To register the new application, run the [Register Microsoft Entra ID Application](Credentials#operation/FinishAppRegistrationByDeviceCode) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Infrastructure` session has been created to add the tenant. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/deployment/{taskId}/downloadKit` endpoint downloads the deployment kit as a ZIP file. Save the ZIP file to the Microsoft Windows server you want to add as a managed server, extract its contents and run the `InstalDeploymentKit.bat` configuration script to install the required packages and certificates.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/managedServers` endpoint adds a server to the backup infrastructure.

If you want to add a Microsoft Hyper-V cluster and include only specific Microsoft Hyper-V hosts, follow these steps:

  1. Add the credentials used to connect to the Microsoft Hyper-V cluster: [Add Credentials Record](Credentials#operation/CreateCreds). You will need to specify the credentials ID in the following requests.
  2. Discover the hosts managed by the cluster: [Get Microsoft Hyper-V Servers Managed by Microsoft Hyper-V Cluster or SCVMM Server](Managed-Servers#operation/ResolveHyperVHosts).
  3. Add the Microsoft Hyper-V cluster using this request. In the request body, specify the necessary hosts.

If you want to add an SCVMM server and include only specific Microsoft Hyper-V hosts, follow these steps:

  1. Add the credentials used to connect to the SCVMM server: [Add Credentials Record](Credentials#operation/CreateCreds). You will need to specify the credentials ID in the following requests.
  2. To add an SCVMM server without hosts, use this request and set `addAllServers` to `false` in the request body .
  3. Discover the hosts managed by the SCVMM server: [Get Microsoft Hyper-V Servers Managed by Microsoft Hyper-V Cluster or SCVMM Server](Managed-Servers#operation/ResolveHyperVHosts).
  4. To add the necessary hosts, edit the SCVMM server: [Edit Server](Managed-Servers#operation/UpdateManagedServer).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Infrastructure` session has been created to add the server. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/managedServers/updateComponents` endpoint updates managed server components.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: A `HostComponentsUpdate` session has been created to update managed server components. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/repositories` endpoint gets an array of all backup repositories that are added to the backup infrastructure.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of repositories to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of repositories to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts repositories by one of the repository parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts repositories in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters repositories by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any repository parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning and/or at the end.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters repositories by repository type.

parameters.name: hostIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters repositories by ID of the backup server.

parameters.name: pathFilter
parameters.description: Filters repositories by path to the folder where backup files are stored.

parameters.name: vmbApiFilter
parameters.description: Filters repositories by VM Backup API parameters converted to the base64 string. To obtain the string, call the `GetApiProductInfoString` method of VM Backup API.

parameters.name: vmbApiPlatform
parameters.description: Filters repositories by ID of a platform that you use to communicate with VM Backup API.

parameters.name: excludeExtents
parameters.description: If `true`, filters out repositories that are a part of an extent for Scale-Out repositories.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/repositories` endpoint adds a repository to the backup infrastructure.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: overwriteOwner
parameters.description: If `true`, the owner of the repository will be overwritten.

201.description: An `Infrastructure` session has been created to add the repository. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/repositories/rescan` endpoint rescans an array of the specified repositories.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: A `ConfigurationResynchronize` session has been created to rescan the repositories. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/repositories/states` endpoint gets an array of all repository states. The states include repository location and brief statistics, such as repository capacity, free and used space.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of repository states to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of repository states to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts repository states by one of the state parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts repository states in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: idFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by repository ID.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any repository state parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning and/or at the end.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by repository type.

parameters.name: capacityFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by repository capacity.

parameters.name: freeSpaceFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by repository free space.

parameters.name: usedSpaceFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by repository used space.

parameters.name: isOnlineFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by repository connection status.

parameters.name: isOutOfDateFilter
parameters.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication returns only repositories with outdated components.

parameters.name: sobrIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by repository ID.

parameters.name: sobrExtentTypeFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states based on the extent type of the scale-out backup repository.

parameters.name: sobrMembershipFilter
parameters.description: Filters repository states by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any repository state parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning and/or at the end.

parameters.name: excludeExtents
parameters.description: Filters out repositories that are a part of an extent for scale-out backup repositories.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/repositories/{id}` endpoint gets a backup repository that has the specified `id`.

parameters.description: Backup repository ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Repositories](Repositories#operation/GetAllRepositories) request.

delete.description:

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/mountServers` endpoint gets managed servers that have been assigned the mount server role.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount servers to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount servers to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount servers by one of the mount server parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount servers in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: writeCacheFolderFilter
parameters.description: Filters mount servers by their write cache folder paths. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters mount servers by the mount server OS.

parameters.name: isDefaultFilter
parameters.description: If `true`, shows only mount servers that are set as default.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/mountServers` endpoint assigns a mount server role to an existing managed server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Infrastructure` session has been created to add a mount server. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/mountServers/{id}` endpoint gets a mount server that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Mount server ID. The ID is the same as the ID of the managed server that was assigned a mount server role. To obtain the ID, run the [Get Mount Servers](Mount-Servers#operation/GetAllMountServers) request.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/mountServers/{id}` endpoint updates the settings of a mount server that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Mount server ID. The ID is the same as the ID of the managed server that was assigned a mount server role. To obtain the ID, run the [Get Mount Servers](Mount-Servers#operation/GetAllMountServers) request.

201.description: An `Infrastructure` session has been created to update the mount server settings. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/mountServers/default` endpoint gets default mount servers.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupInfrastructure/mountServers/{id}/default` endpoint sets a default mount server. After you set a default mount server, this mount server will be assigned to new repositories by default, for targets with the same OS as the mount server.

For example, if you specify a Microsoft Windows machine as a default mount server, all new repositories will use this mount server as the default mount server for advanced recovery operations to Microsoft Windows machines.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Mount server ID. The ID is the same as the ID of the managed server that was assigned a mount server role. To obtain the ID, run the [Get Mount Servers](Mount-Servers#operation/GetAllMountServers) request.

201.description: Default mount server has been configured.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/jobs` endpoint gets an array of all jobs coordinated by the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of jobs to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of jobs to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts jobs by one of the job parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts jobs in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters jobs by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any job parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters jobs by job type.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/jobs` endpoint creates a new job that has the specified parameters.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: Job has been created.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/jobs/states` endpoint gets an array of all job states. The states include brief job information that you can also find under the **Jobs** node in the Veeam Backup & Replication console.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of job states to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of job states to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts job states by one of the state parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts job states in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: idFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by job ID.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any state parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by job type.

parameters.name: lastResultFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by status with which jobs must finish.

parameters.name: statusFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by current status of the job.

parameters.name: workloadFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by workloads that jobs must process.

parameters.name: lastRunAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns job states for jobs that have run after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: lastRunBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns job states for jobs that have not run after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: isHighPriorityJobFilter
parameters.description: If `true`, returns job states for high priority jobs only.

parameters.name: repositoryIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by repository ID.

parameters.name: objectsCountFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by number of objects processed by the job.

parameters.name: afterJobIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by the ID of the job after which the current job will run.

parameters.name: afterJobNameFilter
parameters.description: Filters job states by the name of the job after which the current job will run.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/jobs/{id}` endpoint gets a job that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Job ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Jobs](Jobs#operation/GetAllJobs) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/jobs/{id}/applyConfiguration` endpoint manually applies Veeam Agent backup policy settings to protected computers. This operation is performed automatically when the backup policy is created and during automatic protection group rescan. You may need to manually apply backup policy settings, for example, in case one or more protected computers could not be accessed over the network at the time when the backup policy was created.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Tape Operator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Job ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Jobs](Jobs#operation/GetAllJobs) request.

201.description: An `AgentPolicy` session has been started. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/jobs/{id}/clearCache` endpoint deletes restore points from the backup cache on computers added to the backup policy.

Consider the following:

  • This request is available only for computers that are protected with Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows.
  • This request is not available for computers in protection groups with pre-installed agents.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Tape Operator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the backup policy. To get the ID, run the [Get All Jobs](Jobs#operation/GetAllJobs) request.

201.description: An `AgentPolicy` session has been started to clear the destination cache on protected computers. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/jobs/{id}/clone` endpoint clones a job that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Job ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Jobs](Jobs#operation/GetAllJobs) request.

201.description: Job has been cloned.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/jobs/quickBackup/vSphere` endpoint performs quick backup for the specified VMware vSphere or VMware Cloud Director VM.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator.

201.description: A `BackupJob` session has been started. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of credentials records to skip.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: orderAsc

parameters.name: nameFilter

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns credentials that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter

post.description:

To reduce the response time and the number of records in the response, use `filters` if possible.

parameters.name: resetCache
parameters.description: If `true`, the cache will be reset for this request. Resetting the cache slows down request processing, but it allows you to get up-to-date data.

To reduce the response time and the number of records in the response, use the available filtering in the request body.

parameters.description: If `true`, the cache will be reset for this request. Resetting the cache slows down request processing, but it allows you to get up-to-date data.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backups` endpoint gets an array of all backups that are created on or imported to the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of backups to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of backups to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts backups by one of the backup parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts backups in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters backups by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any backup parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns backups that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns backups that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: platformIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters backups by ID of the backup object platform.

parameters.name: jobIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters backups by ID of the parent job.

parameters.name: policyTagFilter
parameters.description: Filters backups by retention policy tag.

parameters.name: jobTypeFilter
parameters.description: Filters backups by job type.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backups/{id}` endpoint gets a backup that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Backups](Backups#operation/GetAllBackups) request.

delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/backups/{id}` endpoint deletes a backup that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Backups](Backups#operation/GetAllBackups) request.

parameters.name: fromDBIfSPUnavailable
parameters.description: (Only for Veeam Cloud Connect infrastructure) If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication deletes the backup record from the configuration database if the service provider is not available (for example, if a cloud gateway is down, a cloud repository is not available, or the Cloud Connect license is expired).

parameters.name: includeGFS
parameters.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication also deletes the backups with GFS flags (weekly, monthly and yearly full backups).

parameters.name: fromDB
parameters.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication deletes only the record of the backup from the configuration database and keeps the backup in the backup repository.

201.description: OK

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backups/{id}/objects` endpoint gets an array of virtual infrastructure objects (VMs and VM containers) that are included in a backup that has the specified ID.

Types of backup objects differ depending on the backup job platform:

  • Backups of VMware vSphere and Microsoft Hyper-V jobs contain VMs only.
  • Backups of VMware Cloud Director jobs contain VMs and vApps.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Backups](Backups#operation/GetAllBackups) request.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return.

delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/backups/{id}/objects/{objectId}` endpoint deletes an infrastructure object (VM or VM container) included in a backup that has the specified `id`.

Types of backup objects differ depending on the backup job platform:

  • Backups of VMware vSphere jobs contain VMs only.
  • Backups of VMware Cloud Director jobs contain VMs and vApps.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Backups](Backups#operation/GetAllBackups) request.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Object ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Backup Objects](Backups#operation/GetBackupObjectsWithFiltering) request.

parameters.name: fromDBIfSPUnavailable
parameters.description: (Only for Veeam Cloud Connect infrastructure) If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication deletes the backup record from the configuration database if the service provider is not available (for example, if a cloud gateway is down, a cloud repository is not available, or the Cloud Connect license is expired).

parameters.name: includeGFS
parameters.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication also deletes the backups with GFS flags (weekly, monthly and yearly full backups).

201.description: A `DeleteBackup` session has been created to delete the backup. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:

201.description: An `UnstructuredDownloadMeta` session has been created to download the backup metadata. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:

parameters.description: Maximum number of backup files to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts backup files by one of the backup file parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts backup files in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters backup files by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any backup files parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns backup files that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns backup files that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: gfsPeriodFilter
parameters.description: Filters backup files by GFS period.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator.

get.summary: Create Recovery Media for Backup Object
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupObjects/{id}/createRecoveryMedia` endpoint creates Veeam Recovery Media for a backup created by Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows. The request will create an ISO file that you can boot from in case the computer stops working or the hard disk fails.

You can also create Veeam Recovery Media for a computer in a protection group. For more information, see [Create Recovery Media for Discovered Entity](Agents#operation/CreateRecoveryMediaForDiscoveredEntity).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.description: Number of items to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/replicas` endpoint gets an array of all replicas that are created on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of replicas to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of replicas to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts replicas by one of the replica parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts replicas in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters replicas by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any replica parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns replicas that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns replicas that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: platformIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters replicas by ID of the backup object platform.

parameters.name: jobIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters replicas by ID of the parent job.

parameters.name: policyTagFilter
parameters.description: Filters replicas by retention policy unique ID.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters replicas by state.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failover/failoverNow/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint starts failover of VMware vSphere VMs to their snapshot replicas.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: One or more `Failover` sessions have been started to perform the failover. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failover/plannedFailover/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint starts planned failover of VMware vSphere VMs to their snapshot replicas.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: One or more `PlannedFailover` sessions have been started to perform the failover. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failover/permanentFailover/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint starts permanent failover of VMware vSphere VMs to their snapshot replicas.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: One or more `PermanentFailover` sessions have been started to perform the failover. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failover/undoFailover/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint undoes failover for snapshot replicas of VMware vSphere VMs.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: One or more `UndoFailover` sessions have been started to undo the failover. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failback/failbackToProduction/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint starts failback from snapshot replicas to production VMware vSphere VMs.

Failback must be finalized. After you have switched over to production VMs (automatically or manually), do one of the following:

  • If a production VM works as expected, commit failback for the VM.
  • If a production VM does not work as expected, undo failback for the VM.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: One or more `Failback` sessions have been started to perform the failback. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failback/switchToProduction/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint manually starts switchover from snapshot replicas to production VMware vSphere VMs.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: One or more `SwitchReplicaToProduction` sessions have been started to perform switchover. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failback/changeSwitchoverTime/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint changes the time when you want to switch over from snapshot replicas to production VMware vSphere VMs.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

200.description: Switchover time has been changed successfully.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failback/commitFailback/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint commits failback from snapshot replicas to production VMware vSphere VMs.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: One or more `CommitFailback` sessions have been started to commit the failback. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/failback/undoFailback/vSphere/snapshot` endpoint undoes failback from snapshot replicas to production VMware vSphere VMs.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: One or more `UndoFailback` sessions have been started to undo the failback. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/unstructuredData/fileShare` endpoint restores an entire file share to the original or another location.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: A restore session has been created. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

parameters.description: Filters mount points by mount point state.

parameters.description: Filters mount points by file share name.
