**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: An `InstantRecovery` session has been started. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.summary: Get Mount Point for Instant File Share Recovery
get.description:

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant File Share Recovery](Restore#operation/GetAllInstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryMounts) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/unstructuredData/{mountId}/unmount` endpoint stops publishing the file share and removes it from the destination server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant File Share Recovery](Restore#operation/GetAllInstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryMounts) request.

200.description: An `InstantRecovery` session has been started to stop publishing the file share. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/unstructuredData/{mountId}/migrate` endpoint migrates the published file share to production.
NOTE
This operation is supported for backups of SMB file shares only.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant File Share Recovery](Restore#operation/GetAllInstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryMounts) request.

201.description: An `UnstructuredDataMigration` session has been started to migrate the published file share to production. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/unstructuredData/{mountId}/switchover` endpoint starts switchover from the specified mount point.
NOTE
This operation is supported for backups of SMB file shares only.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant File Share Recovery](Restore#operation/GetAllInstantUnstructuredDataRecoveryMounts) request.

201.description: An `InstantRecovery` session has been started to switch the unstructured data. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

You can recover a VM from the specified restore point to the original location with initial VM settings, or to any location but with different settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: An `InstantRecovery` session has been started to start Instant Recovery. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

parameters.name: mountId

post.description:

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Instant Recovery Mount Points of VMware vSphere VMs](Restore#operation/GetAllInstantViVMRecoveryMounts) request.

200.description: A `QuickMigration` session has been started to migrate the VM. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

parameters.name: orderAsc

post.summary: Start Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm` endpoint starts Instant Recovery of a Linux or Microsoft Windows machine to Microsoft Azure.
NOTE
Deploying a helper appliance template with REST API is not supported in this version. Before you run this request, you must deploy a helper appliance template in the Veeam Backup & Replication UI or with the `Deploy-VBRAzureApplianceTemplate` cmdlet.

To get the values required in the request body, run the following requests:

  1. Run the [Get All Restore Points](Restore-Points#operation/GetAllObjectRestorePoints) request to get the `RestorePointId` property value.
  2. Run the [Get Restore Point Disks](Restore-Points#operation/GetObjectRestorePointDisksWithFiltering) request to get the `diskUid` property value.
  3. Run the [Get All Cloud Credentials](Credentials#operation/GetAllCloudCreds) request to get the `subscriptionId` property value.
  4. Run the [Get Cloud Hierarchy](Cloud-Browser#operation/BrowseCloudEntity) request to get the values for the remaining required properties.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Microsoft Azure Instant Recovery mount has been initiated to start Instant Recovery. To check the progress, track the mount state.

get.summary: Get Mount Point for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm/{mountId}` endpoint gets an Instant Recovery mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure](Restore#operation/GetAllAzureInstantVMRecoveryMounts) request.

get.summary: Get All Mount Sessions for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm/{mountId}/sessions` endpoint gets an array of Instant Recovery sessions associated with a mount point.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure](Restore#operation/GetAllAzureInstantVMRecoveryMounts) request.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount sessions to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount sessions to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mounts by one of the mount sessions parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: Sorts mount sessions in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are finished after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are finished before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session type.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session state.

parameters.name: resultFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session result.

post.summary: Stop Publishing Machine to Microsoft Azure
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm/{mountId}/unmount` endpoint stops publishing the recovered VM and removes it from the destination host.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure](Restore#operation/GetAllAzureInstantVMRecoveryMounts) request.

201.description: An `AzureInstantRecoveryStop` session has been started to stop publishing the VM. To check the progress, track the mount state.

post.summary: Start Migrating Machine to Microsoft Azure
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm/{mountId}/migrate` endpoint starts VM migration from the specified Instant Recovery mount point.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure](Restore#operation/GetAllAzureInstantVMRecoveryMounts) request.

201.description: An `AzureInstantRecoveryMigration` session has been started to migrate the VM. To check the progress, track the mount state.

get.summary: Get Settings for Switchover to Microsoft Azure
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm/{mountId}/switchoverSettings` endpoint gets switchover settings for an Instant Recovery mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure](Restore#operation/GetAllAzureInstantVMRecoveryMounts) request.

put.summary: Update Settings for Switchover to Microsoft Azure
put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm/{mountId}/switchoverSettings` endpoint modifies switchover settings for an Instant Recovery mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure](Restore#operation/GetAllAzureInstantVMRecoveryMounts) request.

201.description: The switchover settings have been updated.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/azure/vm/{mountId}/switchover` endpoint starts switchover for a mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Mount Points for Instant Recovery to Microsoft Azure](Restore#operation/GetAllAzureInstantVMRecoveryMounts) request.

201.description: An `AzureInstantRecoverySwitchover` session has been started to initiate a VM switchover. To check the progress, track the mount `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/vmRestore/vSphere` endpoint performs entire VM restore of a VMware vSphere VM to VMware vSphere. You can restore a VM from the specified restore point to the original location with initial VM settings, or to any location but with different settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Restore session has been created. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.summary: Restore Entire VMware Cloud Director VM
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/vmRestore/cloudDirector` endpoint performs entire VM restore of a VMware Cloud Director VM to VMware Cloud Director. You can restore a VM from the specified restore point to the original location with initial VM settings, or to any location but with different settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: A `RestoreVm` session has been created. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/vmRestore/hyperV` endpoint performs entire VM restore of a Microsoft Hyper-V VM to Microsoft Hyper-V. You can restore a VM from the specified restore point to the original location with initial VM settings, or to any location but with different settings.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Restore session has been created. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd` endpoint gets an array of FCD mount points.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters mount points by mount point state.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd` endpoint starts Instant FCD Recovery from the restore point to the destination cluster.

Specify the destination cluster in the `destinationCluster` parameter of the request body as a model of the VMware vSphere object. For details on how to get the cluster model, see [Get Inventory Objects](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryObjects).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Instant FCD Recovery has been started. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd/{mountId}` endpoint gets information about the mounted vPower NFS datastore, such as restore session ID, mount point state, instant FCD recovery settings and disks that will be recovered.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All FCD Mount Points](Restore#operation/GetAllVmwareFcdInstantRecoveryMountModels) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd/{mountId}/dismount` endpoint stops publishing the recovered FCDs and removes the disks from the datastore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All FCD Mount Points](Restore#operation/GetAllVmwareFcdInstantRecoveryMountModels) request.

200.description: The disks have been unmounted. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/instantRecovery/vSphere/fcd/{mountId}/migrate` endpoint starts migration of FCDs from the specified mount point.

In the request body, specify FCD migration configuration:

  • Disks for migration
  • Target datastore
  • Storage policy that will be applied to the migrated disks
For details on how to get models of the datastore and storage policy, see [Get Inventory Objects](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryObjects).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All FCD Mount Points](Restore#operation/GetAllVmwareFcdInstantRecoveryMountModels) request.

200.description: FCD Migration has been started. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/recoveryTokens` endpoint gets an array of all recovery tokens.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of recovery tokens to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of recovery tokens to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts recovery tokens by one of the parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts recovery tokens in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters recovery tokens by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any repository parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/recoveryTokens` endpoint creates a new recovery token.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/recoveryTokens/{id}` endpoint gets a recovery token that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Recovery token ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Recovery Tokens](Agents#operation/GetAllComputerRecoveryTokens) request.

put.description:
The HTTP PUT request to the `/api/v1/agents/recoveryTokens/{id}` endpoint edits settings of a recovery token that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Recovery token ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Recovery Tokens](Agents#operation/GetAllComputerRecoveryTokens) request.

delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/agents/recoveryTokens/{id}` endpoint deletes a recovery token that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Recovery token ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Recovery Tokens](Agents#operation/GetAllComputerRecoveryTokens) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectedComputers` endpoint gets an array of all protected Linux computers.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of protected computers to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of protected computers to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts protected computers by one of the protected computer parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts protected computers in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters protected computers by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any protected computer parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters protected computers by protected computer type.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectedComputers/{id}` endpoint gets a protected Linux computer that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the protected computer.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/jobs/import` endpoint imports jobs to Veeam Backup & Replication.

NOTE
In this REST API version, you can import VMware vSphere backup jobs only.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Automation` session has been created to import the jobs. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/jobs/export` endpoint exports jobs from Veeam Backup & Replication.

NOTE
In this REST API version, you can export VMware vSphere backup jobs only.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/credentials/import` endpoint imports credentials to Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Automation` session has been created to import the credentials. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/credentials/export` endpoint exports credentials from Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/cloudcredentials/import` endpoint imports cloud credentials to Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Automation` session has been created to import the cloud credentials. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/cloudcredentials/export` endpoint exports cloud credentials from Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/proxies/import` endpoint imports backup proxies to Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Automation` session has been created to import the proxies. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/proxies/export` endpoint exports backup proxies from Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/managedServers/import` endpoint imports managed servers to Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Automation` session has been created to import the servers. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/managedServers/export` endpoint exports managed servers from Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/repositories/import` endpoint imports backup repositories to Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Automation` session has been created to import the repositories. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/repositories/export` endpoint exports backup repositories from Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/encryptionPasswords/import` endpoint imports encryption passwords to Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `Automation` session has been created to import the passwords. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/encryptionPasswords/export` endpoint exports encryption passwords from Veeam Backup & Replication.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/automation/sessions` endpoint gets an array of all automation sessions performed on the backup server.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of sessions to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of sessions to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts sessions by one of the session parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts sessions in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any session parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are finished after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: endedBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns sessions that are finished before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session type.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session state.

parameters.name: resultFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by session result.

parameters.name: jobIdFilter
parameters.description: Filters sessions by job ID.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/automation/sessions/{id}` endpoint gets an automation session that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Automation session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Automation Sessions](Automation#operation/GetAllAutomationSessions) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/automation/sessions/{id}/logs` endpoint gets an array of log records of an automation session that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator, Veeam Backup Viewer, Veeam Tape Operator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Automation session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Automation Sessions](Automation#operation/GetAllAutomationSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/automation/sessions/{id}/stop` endpoint stops an automation session that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Backup Operator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Automation session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Automation Sessions](Automation#operation/GetAllAutomationSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/flr` endpoint starts file restore from a backup or replica of a Microsoft Windows or Linux machine. The operation starts a file restore session and mounts the machine file system to a mount point.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: File system has been mounted.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/flr/{sessionId}/unmount` endpoint unmounts the file system from a mount point and stops a file restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: Restore session has been stopped.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/flr/{sessionId}/validateCredentials` endpoint validates the target machine credentials in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Get User Code for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/deviceCode` endpoint obtains a user code required to get credentials for delegated restore of Microsoft Entra ID items.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: User and device codes have been received.

post.summary: Get Credentials for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/deviceCode/state` endpoint gets credentials that are required for delegated restore of Microsoft Entra ID items. Before you request the credentials, obtain a user code using the [Get User Code for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items](Restore#operation/GetEntraIdTenantRestoreDeviceCode) request.

You can use the credentials in the following requests:

  • [Restore Microsoft Entra ID Items](Backup-Browsers#operation/RestoreEntraIdTenantItems)
  • [Restore Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties](Backup-Browsers#operation/RestoreEntraIdTenantItemAttributes)

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

get.summary: Get Redirect URI for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/{sessionId}/authCode/startAuthorization` endpoint obtains a redirect URI required to perform authorization code flow for delegated restore of Microsoft Entra ID items.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

"

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID.

parameters.name: vdcSessionId
parameters.description: VDC session ID.

parameters.name: redirectUri
parameters.description: Application redirect uri (where code will be redirected to).

post.summary: Perform Authorization Code Exchange for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/authCode/authorize` endpoint performs code exchange part of authorization code flow for delegated restore of Microsoft Entra ID items.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

"

200.description: Authorization code exchange has been successful.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant` endpoint mounts a Microsoft Entra ID tenant from its backup and starts a mount session required for Microsoft Entra ID tenant restore.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Tenant has been mounted.

post.summary: Start Microsoft Entra ID Tenant Restore from Copy
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/fromCopy` endpoint starts restore from backup copy for a Microsoft Entra ID tenant.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: An `EntraIdRestoreFromCopy` session has been created to start restore from backup copy for a Microsoft Entra ID tenant. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/tenant/{sessionId}/stop` endpoint unmounts a Microsoft Entra ID tenant and stops a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID.

201.description: Mount session has been stopped.

post.summary: Start Microsoft Entra ID Audit Log Restore
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/auditLog` endpoint starts the Microsoft Entra ID audit log restore from a backup of Microsoft Entra ID audit logs. The operation starts a file restore session and mounts the log files to a mount point.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: Log files have been mounted.

post.summary: Unmount Microsoft Entra ID Audit Logs
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/restore/entraId/auditLog/{sessionId}/unmount` endpoint unmounts Microsoft Entra ID log files from a mount point and stops a file restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID.

201.description: Restore session has been stopped.

get.summary: Get All Disk Publishing Mount Points
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/dataIntegration` endpoint gets an array of mount points for disk publishing operations.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters mount points by mount point state.

parameters.name: modeFilter
parameters.description: Filters mount points by mount mode.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/dataIntegration/publish` endpoint starts a disk publishing session.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

201.description: A `PublishBackupContentViaMount` session has been started to publish disks. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/dataIntegration/{mountId}` endpoint gets a disk publishing mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/dataIntegration/{mountId}/unpublish` endpoint stops publishing a mount point that has the specified `mountID`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: mountId
parameters.description: Mount point ID.

200.description: A `PublishBackupContentViaMount` session has been started to unpublish disks. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.summary: Get All File Restore Mount Points
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr` endpoint gets an array of all active file restore mount points.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}` endpoint gets a file restore mount point that was created by a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/audit` endpoint gets an aggregated view of items restored during a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/browse` endpoint browses file system items (drives, folders, files and links) available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can use this request in the following cases:

  • To browse the file system before you restore an item
  • To check the item state (changed, not changed, and so on) after you have compared the item in the backup and on the production machine

    • **Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/compareAttributes` endpoint compares attributes of file system items (drives, folders, files and links) from a restore session that has the specified `sessionId` with attributes of original items.

NOTE
The operation is allowed for Microsoft Windows machines only.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/compareToProduction` endpoint compares file system items (drives, folders, files and links) on the production machine with the items available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`. After the comparison completes, check the comparison results using the [Browse File System](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseFlrMount) request.

NOTE
The operation is allowed for Microsoft Windows machines only.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/search` endpoint creates a search task to find required file system items (drives, folders, files and links) available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

To get the search results, run the [Browse Search Results](Backup-Browsers#operation/FlrBrowseSearchResult) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrSearch` task has been created to search for file system items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/search/{taskId}/browse` endpoint browses search results of a search task that has the specified `taskId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: ID of the search task.

post.summary: Restore Files and Folders to Original Location
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/restore` endpoint restores file system items (folders, files and links) to the original location.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/restoreTo` endpoint restores file system items (folders, files and links) to another location.

201.description: An `FlrRestore` task has been created to restore the items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.summary: Prepare Files and Folders for Download
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/prepareDownload` endpoint prepares files and folders for download and packs them into a ZIP file. In response, a download task is created.

To download the ZIP file, specify the task ID in the [Download Files and Folders](Backup-Browsers#operation/DownloadFlrItem) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrDownload` task has been created to restore the items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/{sessionId}/prepareDownload/{taskId}/download` endpoint downloads a ZIP archive with files and folders of a download task that has the specified `taskId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All File Restore Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllFlrBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Download task ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Tasks](Tasks#operation/GetAllTasks) request.

get.summary: Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData` endpoint gets all or specified active unstructured data mount points.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of mount points to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of mount points to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts mount points by one of the mount point parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts mount points in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}` endpoint gets an unstructured data mount point that was created by a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/browse` endpoint browses file system items (drives, folders, files and links) available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can use this request in the following cases:

  • To browse the file system before you restore an item
  • To check the item state (changed, not changed, and so on) after you have compared the item in the backup and on the production machine

    • **Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Search for Files and Folders in Unstructured Data Mount Point
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/search` endpoint creates a search task to find required file system items (drives, folders, files and links) available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`.

To get the search results, run the [Browse Search Results in Unstructured Data Mount Point](Backup-Browsers#operation/UnstructuredDataFlrBrowseSearchResult) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrSearch` task has been created to search for file system items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.summary: Browse Search Results in Unstructured Data Mount Point
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/search/{taskId}/browse` endpoint browses search results of a search task that has the specified `taskId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Search task ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Tasks](Tasks#operation/GetAllTasks) request.

post.summary: Copy Files and Folders to Specific Folder
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/copyTo` endpoint copies file system items (folders, files and links) to the machine where the Veeam Backup & Replication console is installed or to a network shared folder.

When copying symbolic links, Veeam Backup & Replication copies the content that the links point to.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrRestore` task has been created to restore the items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.summary: Restore Files and Folders from Unstructured Data Backup
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/restore` endpoint restores unstructured data items.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

201.description: An `FlrRestore` task has been created to restore the items. To check the progress, track the task `state`.

post.summary: Compare Attributes of Unstructured Data Backup with Source
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/compareAttributes` endpoint compares attributes of unstructured data items from a restore session that has the specified `sessionId` with attributes of original items.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Compare Files and Folders of Unstructured Data Backup with Source
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/flr/unstructuredData/{sessionId}/compareToProduction` endpoint compares unstructured data items on the production share with the items available in a restore session that has the specified `sessionId`. After the comparison completes, check the comparison results using the [Browse Unstructured Data File System](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseFLRUnstructuredDataMount) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Restore session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get All Unstructured Data Mount Points](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllUnstructuredDataFLRBrowseSessions) request.

post.description:

This request helps you find the restore point from which you want to restore tenant items.

parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Microsoft Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

get.description:

parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Microsoft Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

Use this request to find the items that you want to restore. In the request body, you must specify an item type: user, group, administrative unit, role or application.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: backupId
parameters.description: Backup ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Microsoft Entra ID Tenants](#Backup-Browsers/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: itemId

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/validate` endpoint validates that Microsoft Entra ID items specified in the request body are available in a specified restore point.

In the response body, you receive an array of items that are missing in the restore point. To browse restore points that are available for each of the missing items, run the [Get Restore Points of Microsoft Entra ID Item](Backup-Browsers#operation/BrowseEntraIdTenantRestorePoints) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId

parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Microsoft Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Compare Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/compare` endpoint compares the properties of a Microsoft Entra ID item available in a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can compare item properties either between 2 restore points or between a restore point and production. To compare the item to production, do not specify `newRestorePointId`.

This request is synchronous, meaning that the client will wait until comparison results are ready. Alternatively, you can use an asynchronous request that returns a comparison session immediately so the client can continue execution, and you can process the comparison results later when the session changes its state to `Success`. For details on the asynchronous request, see [Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties](Backup-Browsers#operation/StartCompareEntraIdTenantItem).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Microsoft Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

post.summary: Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/startCompare` endpoint starts comparing the properties of a Microsoft Entra ID item available in a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can compare item properties either between 2 restore points or between a restore point and production. To compare the item to production, do not specify `newRestorePointId`.

This request is asynchronous, meaning that the request returns a comparison session immediately so the client can continue execution, and you can process the comparison results later when the session changes its state to `Success`. To get the comparison results, run the [Get Comparison Results for Microsoft Entra ID Items](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetCompareEntraIdTenantItemResult) request. For details on synchronous request, see [Compare Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties](Backup-Browsers#operation/CompareEntraIdTenantItem).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Microsoft Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

get.summary: Get Comparison Results for Microsoft Entra ID Items
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/compare/{compareSessionId}/result` endpoint gets comparison results for Microsoft Entra ID items, initiated by a comparison session with the specified `sessionId`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Microsoft Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

parameters.name: compareSessionId
parameters.description: Comparison session ID. To get the ID, run the [Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Item Properties](Backup-Browsers#operation/StartCompareEntraIdTenantItem) request.

post.summary: Start Comparing Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access Policy
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/backupBrowser/entraIdTenant/{sessionId}/startRecursiveCompare` endpoint starts a recursive comparison of the properties of a Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access policy available in a mount session that has the specified `sessionId`.

You can compare item properties either between 2 restore points or between a restore point and production. To compare the item to production, do not specify `newRestorePointId`.

This request is asynchronous, meaning that the request returns a comparison session immediately so the client can continue execution, and you can process the comparison results later when the session changes its state to `Success`. To get the comparison results, run the [Get Comparison Results for Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access Policy](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetRecursiveComparisonEntraIdTenantItemResult) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator.

"

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: Mount session ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Mount Points of All Microsoft Entra ID Tenants](Backup-Browsers#operation/GetAllEntraIdTenantBrowseSessions) request.

get.description:

parameters.name: endedBeforeFilter

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: Filters tasks by task type.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters tasks by task state.

parameters.name: resultFilter
parameters.description: Filters tasks by task result.

get.description:

get.description:

parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: Maximum number of events to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts events by one of the event parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts events in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: typeFilter

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/backupObjects/markAsClean` endpoint marks as clean backup objects that were flagged as suspicious or infected. Use this request if you cleaned the machine of malware or the malware detection event was a false positive.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/yaraRules` endpoint gets YARA rules located in the Veeam Backup & Replication installation folder. The default path is `%ProgramFiles%\Veeam\Backup and Replication\Backup\YaraRules` for Microsoft Windows-based backup servers and `/var/lib/veeam/yara_rules` for Linux-based backup servers.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Restore Operator, Incident API Operator.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/malwareDetection/scanBackup` endpoint scans backups with antivirus or YARA rules.

201.description: A `SureBackup` session has been created to scan the backup. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/authorization/events` endpoint gets an array of security-related events. These events cover the following operation types:
  • Approved and rejected requests
  • Updated four-eyes authorization settings
  • Updated settings for users and user groups
  • Assigned roles
  • Added or deleted users and user groups

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator, Veeam Security Administrator.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of authorization events to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of authorization events to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts authorization events by one of the authorization event parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: If `true`, sorts authorization events in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters authorization events by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any authorization event parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning, at the end or both.

parameters.name: createdAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that are created after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: createdBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that are created before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: processedAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that are processed after the specified date and time.

parameters.name: processedBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that are processed before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters authorization events by state.

parameters.name: createdByFilter
parameters.description: Filters authorization events created by the specified user.

parameters.name: processedByFilter
parameters.description: Filters authorization events processed by the specified user.

parameters.name: expireBeforeFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that expire before the specified date and time.

parameters.name: expireAfterFilter
parameters.description: Returns authorization events that expire after the specified date and time.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/authorization/events/{id}` endpoint gets an authorization event that has the specified `id`.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/exportlogs` endpoint starts an export session for Veeam Backup & Replication logs. You can export all logs or the logs generated within a particular time range. To download the logs, run the [Download Logs](Log-export#operation/DownloadSupportLogBundle) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

201.description: An `InfrastructureItemDeletion` session has been created to delete the protection group. To check the progress, track the session `state`.

parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/enable` endpoint enables a protection group.

parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/packages` endpoint downloads agent installation packages for the protection group. Use this request with protection groups with pre-installed backup agents.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities` endpoint gets a list of discovered entities — a list of individual computers, clusters or Active Directory objects processed in the scope of the protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of discovered entities to skip.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of discovered entities to return.

parameters.name: orderColumn
parameters.description: Sorts discovered entities by one of the discovered entity parameters.

parameters.name: orderAsc
parameters.description: Sorts discovered entities in ascending order by the `orderColumn` parameter.

parameters.name: nameFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by the `nameFilter` pattern. The pattern can match any discovered entity parameter. To substitute one or more characters, use the asterisk (*) character at the beginning and/or at the end.

parameters.name: ipAddressFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by the `ipAddressFilter` pattern.

parameters.name: stateFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by their states.

parameters.name: agentStatusFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by the installed agent status.

parameters.name: driverStatusFilter
parameters.description: Filters discovered entities by the installed driver status.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/rescan` endpoint starts rescan jobs, which can install or upgrade agents on a subset of discovered entities in the protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/installAgent` endpoint installs Veeam Agent on discovered entities in the protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/uninstallAgent` endpoint uninstalls Veeam Agent from discovered entities in the protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/upgradeAgent` endpoint upgrades the Veeam Agent on discovered entities in the protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.summary: Install CBT Driver on Discovered Entities
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/installCBTDriver` endpoint installs the Changed Block Tracking (CBT) driver on discovered entities in the protection group that has the specified `id`.

This operation may be required, for example, if you want to evaluate driver performance on a selected computer rather than deploy the driver to all computers in the protection group at once. To enable the CBT driver after installation, reboot the computer.

Consider the following:

  • This request is available only for computers that are protected with Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows.
  • This request is not available for computers in protection groups with pre-installed agents. In this case, use the Veeam Agent Configurator instead.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.summary: Uninstall CBT Driver from Discovered Entities
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/uninstallCBTDriver` endpoint uninstalls the Changed Block Tracking (CBT) driver from discovered entities in the protection group that has the specified `id`. To complete the driver uninstallation process, reboot the computer.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.summary: Uninstall All Components from Discovered Entities
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/uninstallAllComponents` endpoint uninstalls all components from discovered entities in the protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

post.summary: Add Discovered Entities to Trusted Hosts List
post.description:
The HTTP POST request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/trust` endpoint adds discovered Linux computers to the trusted hosts list, in the protection group that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the protection group ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

204.description: The discovered computers have been added to the trusted hosts list.

get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/{entityId}` endpoint gets a discovered entity that has the specified `id`.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

parameters.name: entityId

delete.description:
The HTTP DELETE request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/{entityId}` endpoint removes a discovered entity that has the specified `id` from the configuration.

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: Discovered entity ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Discovered Entities](Agents#operation/GetDiscoveredEntities) request.

get.summary: Create Recovery Media for Discovered Entity
get.description:
The HTTP GET request to the `/api/v1/agents/protectionGroups/{id}/discoveredEntities/{entityId}/createRecoveryMedia` endpoint creates Veeam Recovery Media for a protected Microsoft Windows computer. The request will create an ISO file that you can boot from in case the computer stops working or the hard disk fails.

You can also create Veeam Recovery Media for a backup created by Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows. For more information, see [Create Recovery Media for Backup](Backup-Objects#operation/CreateRecoveryMediaForBackupObject).

**Available to**: Veeam Backup Administrator.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Protection group ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Protection Groups](Agents#operation/GetAllProtectionGroups) request.

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: Discovered entity ID. To get the ID, run the [Get Discovered Entities](Agents#operation/GetDiscoveredEntities) request.

BadRequest.description: Bad request. This error is related to POST/PUT requests. The request body is malformed, incomplete or otherwise invalid.

Forbidden.description: Forbidden. The user sending the request does not have adequate privileges to access one or more objects specified in the request.

InternalServerError.description: Internal server error. The request has been received but could not be completed because of an internal error at the server side.

MethodNotAllowed.description: Method not allowed. Indicates that the server knows the request method, but the target resource does not support this method.

NotFound.description: Not found. No object was found with the path parameter specified in the request.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized. The authorization header has been expected but not found (or found but is expired).

AgentBackupJobPersonalFilesInclusionMode.description: Scope of personal data included in Agent backup job.

desktop.description: If `true`, data stored in the `Desktop` folder will be included in the backup scope.

documents.description: If `true`, data stored in the `Documents` folder will be included in the backup scope.

pictures.description: If `true`, data stored in the `Pictures` folder will be included in the backup scope.

video.description: If `true`, data stored in the `Video` folder will be included in the backup scope.

music.description: If `true`, data stored in the `Music` folder will be included in the backup scope.

favorites.description: If `true`, data stored in the `Favorites` folder will be included in the backup scope.

downloads.description: If `true`, data stored in the `Downloads` folder will be included in the backup scope.

appData.description: If `true`, application data will be included in the backup scope.

other.description: If `true`, data stored in custom locations will be included in the backup scope.

AgentBackupPolicyScheduleAtEventsModel.description: Settings for backups scheduled at a particular event.

backupAtLock.description: If `true`, Veeam Agent backup job will start when the user locks the protected computer.

backupAtLogoff.description: If `true`, Veeam Agent backup job will start when the user working with the protected computer performs a logout operation.

backupAtStorageAttach.description: If `true`, Veeam Agent backup job will start when the backup storage becomes available.

ejectStorageAfterBackup.description: If `true`, Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows will unmount the storage device after the backup job completes successfully.

isEnabled.description: If `true`, backup cache is enabled. This feature allows you to create restore points in temporary local storage where Veeam Agent creates backup files in case a remote backup location is unavailable at the time of backup. Note that this option is only supported with Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows.

localPath.description: Path to the folder on a protected computer in which backup files will be stored. Specify this property if you have specified the `Manual` option for the `type` property.

sizeLimit.description: Maximum size of the backup cache. The unit is specified in the `sizeUnit` property.

x-enumDescriptions.Manual: Veeam Agent for Microsoft allows you to manually specify a location for the backup cache. If you select this option, in the `localPath` property, specify a path to the folder on a protected computer in which backup files will be stored.

EEntireVMRestoreModeType.description:
Entire VM restore mode. | Enum Value | Description | |--------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | OriginalLocation | Veeam Backup & Replication will restore the entire VM to the original location. | | Customized | Veeam Backup & Replication will restore the entire VM to a new location or to the original location with new settings.

Note: If you do not specify an optional property that defines target settings (such as VM name, destination host, resource pool, datastore, folder or network), Veeam Backup & Replication will try to use the source settings for that property. |

ELoginGrantType.description:
Authorization grant type.

Available values:

  • `password` — used to obtain an access token by providing a user name and password.
  • `refresh_token` — used to refresh an expired or lost access token by providing a refresh token.
  • `authorization_code` — used to obtain an access token by providing an authorization code.
  • `vbr_token` — used to obtain an access token by providing a Veeam Backup & Replication token. This grant type is only used in a restricted mode for integration with Veeam Backup & Replication.

subject.description:
Notification subject. Use the following variables in the subject:
  • *%Time%* — completion time
  • *%JobName%* — job name
  • *%JobResult%* — job result
  • *%ObjectCount%* — number of VMs in the job
  • *%Issues%* — number of VMs in the job that have finished with the Warning or Failed status

notifyOnSuccess.description: If `true`, email notifications are sent when the job completes successfully.

notifyOnWarning.description: If `true`, email notifications are sent when the job completes with a warning.

notifyOnError.description: If `true`, email notifications are sent when the job fails.

SuppressNotificationUntilLastRetry.description: If `true`, email notifications are sent about the final job status only (not per every job retry).

isEnabled.description: If `true`, email notifications are enabled for this job.

dailyReportSummarylocalTime.description: Time when daily report summary is sent.

isEnabled.description: If `true`, email notifications are enabled for this job.

x-enumDescriptions.MostRecent: Use this mode if you think a cyber-attack started recently. Restore points will be scanned sequentially, starting from the most recent restore point, until a malware-free restore point is found.
x-enumDescriptions.AllInInterval: Use this mode to scan backup content with necessary YARA rules. Restore points will be scanned sequentially and a malware event will be initiated.
x-enumDescriptions.FirstInInterval: Use this mode if you are not sure when the attack started. Restore points will be scanned in optimal order until a malware-free restore point is found.

showUnchangedAttributes.description: If `true`, both changed and unchanged item properties are returned. Otherwise, only changed ones.

reloadCache.description:
This property is only used when comparing the item to production (`newRestorePointId` must not be specified).
  • If `true`, the mount session cache will be reset for this request and new data will be obtained from Microsoft Entra ID.
  • If `false`, the data will be obtained from the cache.
Resetting the cache slows down request processing, but allows you to get up-to-date data. To check the time when the cache was last updated, use the `cacheTimestamp` property in the response body.

ID of the credentials record used for connection to the target tenant. The property is used only for delegated restore by a restore operator that does not have access to pre-saved credentials. To obtain the credentials, use the following requests:
  1. Obtain a user code: [Get User Code for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items](Restore#operation/GetEntraIdTenantRestoreDeviceCode).
  2. Use the user code to get the credentials ID: [Get Credentials for Delegated Restore of Microsoft Entra ID Items](Restore#operation/GetEntraIdTenantRestoreDeviceCodeState).

skipRecycleBinRestore.description:
If `true`, all of the items are restored from the backup.

Otherwise, the items are restored from the Microsoft Entra ID recycle bin. If an item is not found in the recycle bin, it will not be restored.

skipObjectsIfExist.description: If `true`, only non-existing items are restored.

requestPasswordChangeOnLogon.description: If `true`, restored users will be forced to change their passwords after their first logon.

EPostBackupAction.description: Action that Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows will perform after the backup job completes successfully.

x-enumDescriptions.KeepRunning: Select this option if the protected computer must keep on working.
x-enumDescriptions.Sleep: Select this option if you want Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows to bring the protected computer to the standby mode.
x-enumDescriptions.Hibernate: Select this option if you want Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows to bring the protected computer to the hibernate mode. Note that this option is available if the hibernate mode is enabled on the protected computer.
x-enumDescriptions.Shutdown: Select this option if you want Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows to shut down the protected computer.

x-enumDescriptions.SkipBackup: Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows will perform backup at the next scheduled time. Select this option if you do not want Veeam Agent for Microsoft Windows to start the scheduled backup job when the computer is powered on.
