EPublishBackupContentModeType.description:
Disk publishing mount mode.
  • ISCSITarget — Automatic iSCSI mode. Use this mode if you want Veeam Backup & Replication to automatically configure the iSCSI initiator, start an iSCSI session and allow the specified target Microsoft Windows server to access disk content.
  • ISCSIWindowsMount — Manual iSCSI mode. Use this mode if you want to manually start an iSCSI session from any Microsoft Windows server that has access to the iSCSI target server (mount server).
  • FUSELinuxMount — FUSE mode. Use this mode to allow the specified target Linux or Unix server to access disk content.

EReplicaFailbackType.description:
Failback type.
  • `OriginalLocation` — Failback to the original VM that resides in the original location
  • `OriginalVM` — Failback to the original VM that was restored to a different location
  • `Customized` — Failback to a custom location

ERepositoryConnectionType.description: Repository connection type (direct or through a gateway server).

ERepositoryFiltersOrderColumn.description: Sorts repositories by one of the repository parameters.

ERepositoryStatesFiltersOrderColumn.description: Orders repositories by the specified column.

ERetainLogBackupsType.description: Retention policy for the logs stored in the backup repository.

ERotatedDriveCleanupMode.description:
Cleanup mode:
  • `Disabled` — continue the backup chain on an inserted drive.
  • `ClearBackupFolder` — delete existing backups belonging to the job.
  • `ClearRepositoryFolder` — delete all existing backups from repository.

errorCode.description: The error code is a string that uniquely identifies an error condition and should be understood by programs that detect and handle errors by type.

message.description: The error message contains a generic description of the error condition in English. It is intended for a human audience.

resourceId.description: ID of the object that is involved in the error (or empty).

EScaleOutRepositoryExtentType.description: Type of scale-out backup repository extent.

ESennightOfMonth.description: Week of a month when a monthly backup is created.

ESharedFolderType.description: Shared folder type. Specifies the protocol that you will use to keep backups on shared folders. By default, the request will use the `SMB` type.

ESmbV3HostType.description: Type of the Microsoft SMB3 server.

ESocketLicenseObjectType.description: Type of host covered by socket license.

ESocketWorkloadsFiltersOrderColumn.description: Sorts licensed hosts according to one of the parameters.

EStorageOptimization.description: Storage optimization (depends on the target storage type and the size of your files).

ETaskSessionsFiltersOrderColumn.description: Sorts task sessions according to one of the parameters.

ETransactionLogsSettings.description:
Transaction logs settings that define whether copy-only backups must be created, or transaction logs for Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft SQL and Oracle VMs must be processed.

If transaction log processing is selected, specify the following parameters:

  • [For Microsoft SQL Server VMs] Microsoft SQL Server transaction log settings
  • [For Oracle VMs] Oracle archived log settings

EUnixPackageFiltersOrderColumn.description: Sorts Unix packages by one of the parameters.

EUnstructuredDataArchivalType.description: Filter settings for file versions that you want to keep on the archive repository.

EUnstructuredDataFLRRestoreMode.description:
Restore point settings.

Use this property if you have specified the `unstructuredDataServerId` and the `backupId` properties in the [Start File Restore from Unstructured Data Backup](Restore#operation/StartUnstructuredDataFlrMount) request that you used to mount the share. In this case, you provide information about the restore point in this property.

Do not use this property if you have specified the `restorePointId` property in the [Start File Restore from Unstructured Data Backup](Restore#operation/StartUnstructuredDataFlrMount) request. In this case, Veeam Backup & Replication uses the restore point whose ID you specified.

x-enumDescriptions.Skip: Veeam Backup & Replication keeps the existing file and does not overwrite the existing file with the restored one.
x-enumDescriptions.ReplaceOlder: Veeam Backup & Replication overwrites the existing file only if it is older than the restored file. Use this option if the share was reverted to a storage snapshot.
x-enumDescriptions.ReplaceNewer: Veeam Backup & Replication overwrites the existing file only if the restored file is older than the source share file. Use this option to discard unwanted changes to the file content.
x-enumDescriptions.Overwrite: Veeam Backup & Replication overwrites the existing file.

EUnstructuredDataServersFiltersOrderColu.description: Sorts unstructured data servers by one of the unstructured data server parameters.

EvCentersInventoryFiltersOrderColumn.description: Sorts vCenter Servers by one of the job parameters.

EViHostType.description: Type of the VMware vSphere server.

EViRootFiltersOrderColumn.description: Sorts VMware vSphere servers by one of the VMware vSphere server parameters.

EVirusDetectionAction.description: Action that Veeam Backup & Replication takes if the antivirus software finds a threat.

x-enumDescriptions.ProductionStorage: Veeam Backup & Replication retrieves VM data from datastores connected to the source ESXi host.
x-enumDescriptions.BackupFiles: Veeam Backup & Replication retrieves VM data from the backup chain already existing in the selected backup repositories. Use this option if you perform replication from backup.

EVmwareInventoryType.description: Type of the VMware vSphere object.

EWindowsVolumeType.description: Volume type of the Microsoft Windows machine.

x-enumDescriptions.DateRange: Veeam Backup & Replication will export the logs generated within a certain time range.
x-enumDescriptions.All: Veeam Backup & Replication will export all logs. Note that this may result in a very large log bundle.

subject.description:
Notification subject. Use the following variables in the subject:
  • %Time% — completion time
  • %JobName% — job name
  • %JobResult% — job result
  • %ObjectCount% — number of VMs in the job
  • %Issues% — number of VMs in the job that have been processed with the Warning or Failed status

notifyOnFailure.description: If `true`, email notifications are sent when the job fails.

notifyOnLastRetry.description: If `true`, email notifications are sent about the final job status only (not per every job retry).

hierarchyType.description:
Hierarchy type. The possible values you can specify depend on the used request.

  • For the [Get All Servers](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetAllInventoryHosts) and [Get Inventory Objects](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryObjects) requests, specify values depending on the virtualization platform:
    • For VMware vSphere: *HostsAndClusters*, *DatastoresAndVms*, *HostsAndDatastores*, *VmsAndTemplates*, *VmsAndTags*, *Network*
    • For VMware Cloud Director: *VAppsAndVms*, *Network*, *StoragePolicies*, *Datastores*
    • For Microsoft Hyper-V: *HostsAndVMs*, *Hosts*, *HostsAndVolumes*, *VMGroups*, *Tags*, *Network*
  • For the [Get All Protection Groups](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetAllInventoryPGs) and [Get Inventory Objects for Specific Protection Group](Inventory-Browser#operation/GetInventoryForPG) requests, use the following values: *Computers*, *Clusters*

resetCache.description: If `true`, the cache will be reset for this request. Resetting the cache slows down request processing, but it allows you to get up-to-date data.

forceStandaloneMode.description:
This property is only used with backup servers managed by Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
  • If `true`, license will be installed.
  • If `false` or the property is not specified, the request will return an error, warning you that the backup server is managed by Enterprise Manager.

This property is only used with backup servers managed by Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
  • If `true`, the license will be removed.
  • If `false` or the property is not specified, the request will return an error, warning you that the backup server is managed by Enterprise Manager.

This property is only used with backup servers managed by Veeam Backup Enterprise Manager.
  • If `true`, license will be renewed.
  • If `false` or the property is not specified, the request will return an error, warning you that the backup server is managed by Enterprise Manager.

PerformanceTierAdvancedSettingsModel.description: Advanced settings of the performance tier.

perVmBackup.description:
If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication creates a separate backup file for every VM in the job.

Consider the following:

  • For repositories created after Veeam Backup & Replication 13, the value is always set to `true`.
  • For repositories created before Veeam Backup & Replication 13, the behavior depends on the value that is already selected.
    • If `perVMBackup` is set to `true`, you cannot set it to `false`.
    • If `perVMBackup` is set to `false`, you can set it to `true`, but you cannot set it back to `false`.

fullWhenExtentOffline.description: If `true`, Veeam Backup & Replication creates a full backup file instead of an incremental backup file in case the required extent is offline.

I/O latency limit (in milliseconds) at which Veeam Backup & Replication will slow down read and write operations for datastores or volumes.

`latencyLimitMs` must not be greater than `throttlingIOLimitMs`.

Machine that you want to mark with the malware event. Specify at least 2 parameters.

Note that Veeam Backup & Replication can identify a machine by its FQDN, IPv4 address and IPv6 address only if the machine has been powered on during the backup. If you back up a powered-off machine, Veeam Backup & Replication will not get the machine IP addresses and domain name and will not be able to identify the machine.
